title: Leadership & Structure
introContent:
Delaware DSA is a member-led organization with a democratically elected leadership team. Our chapter operates under a democratic socialist framework where all major decisions are made by the general membership at monthly meetings.

Our elected officers serve one-year terms and are responsible for implementing the decisions and priorities established by our membership. We maintain a commitment to transparency, accountability, and inclusive leadership.
fallbackContent:
Delaware DSA is a member-led organization with a democratically elected leadership team. Our chapter is structured to ensure accountability, transparency, and member involvement at every level.

Our elected officers serve one-year terms and are responsible for implementing the decisions and priorities established by our membership.

chapterStructure.title: Chapter Structure
chapterStructure.description: Delaware DSA operates with a democratic structure designed to ensure member control and participation:

generalMembership.title: General Membership
generalMembership.description: All dues-paying members in good standing have voting rights at general meetings and hold the highest decision-making authority in the chapter.

steeringCommittee.title: Steering Committee
steeringCommittee.description: Composed of 5 elected officers and 2 branch chairs, the Steering Committee administers chapter affairs and implements membership decisions.

branches.title: Geographic Branches
branches.description: Northern Branch (New Castle County) and Southern Branch (Kent & Sussex Counties) provide regional representation and organizing.

committees.title: Standing Committees
committees.description: Political Education, Communications, Membership Engagement, Red Rabbits, and Socialists-in-Office committees handle ongoing chapter functions.

workingGroups.title: Working Groups
workingGroups.description: Issue-based and identity-based working groups focus on specific campaigns including Housing Justice, Migrant Rights, and Queer Socialists.

chapterStructure.meetingsInfo: We hold a minimum of 4 General Meetings each year plus an annual convention. Steering Committee meetings occur regularly with 4 days notice to members. All meetings follow democratic procedures and meeting minutes are made available to ensure transparency.

officerStructure.title: Chapter Officers
officerStructure.description: Our five elected officers serve one-year terms and coordinate the day-to-day operations of the chapter:

officers.responsibilities: Chief executive officers who facilitate meetings, serve as public spokespersons, coordinate daily operations, and maintain communication with national DSA.
officers.requirements: Cannot simultaneously serve as Branch Chair. Must get Steering Committee approval before acting as spokesperson.

officers.responsibilities: Maintains membership lists, handles correspondence, takes meeting minutes, maintains official records, and manages the chapter's digital security systems.
officers.requirements: Transfers all official records to successor in good condition.

officers.responsibilities: Manages chapter funds and financial records, handles reimbursements, ensures dues are current, prepares annual budget and financial reports.
officers.requirements: All expenditures over $500 require Steering Committee approval.

officers.responsibilities: Oversees membership growth and engagement, co-chairs the Member Engagement Committee, organizes inclusive recruitment with special attention to marginalized groups.
officers.requirements: Activities must be inclusive, culturally competent, and non-oppressive.

diversityRequirements.genderRequirement: Two or more elected officers must be women, transgender, non-binary, or any combination of these categories.
diversityRequirements.bipocRequirement: Two or more elected officers must be Black, Indigenous, and/or People of Color (BIPOC).
diversityRequirements.note: Requirements determined solely by officers' own identification and are waived if insufficient candidates.

governanceProcess.title: Democratic Governance
governanceProcess.description: Our chapter operates on principles of democratic decision-making and member participation:

processes.title: Elections
processes.description: All officers and branch chairs are elected annually by chapter members. Elections use secure online voting platforms with at least 14 days for chapter elections and 7 days for branch elections.

processes.title: Resolutions
processes.description: Any member in good standing can bring resolutions to General Meetings with endorsement from at least 5 chapter members and one month advance notice to the Steering Committee.

processes.title: Recall Process
processes.description: Officers can be recalled through petition signed by two-thirds of voters from the previous election, followed by a supermajority vote of two-thirds to remove.

processes.title: Amendments
processes.description: Bylaws can be amended with a two-thirds membership vote, 30 days advance notice, and sponsorship by at least 3% of chapter members.
